document.docAuthor: Martínez, Leonel, Brescovit, Antonio D. & Quijano, Luis G.
document.masterDocTitle: Revealing the diversity of ant-eating spiders in Colombia I: morphology, distribution and taxonomy of the barronus group of the genus Tenedos O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1897 (Araneae: Zodariidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revealing the diversity of ant-eating spiders in Colombia I: morphology, distribution and taxonomy of the barronus group of the genus Tenedos O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1897 (Araneae: Zodariidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Naibena barrona
Chamberlin, 1925: 214
( Holotype immature female from Isla Barro Colorado , Panama , deposited in MCZ 1267 , not examined).

Storena barroana : Chickering, 1947: 133
, figs 1–7 (descriptions of male allotype and female hypotype).

Tenedos barronus : Jocqué, 1991: 96
, figs 8, 17, 24, 213–219, 250;
Jocqué & Baert, 2002: 87
, figs 10A–D, 24C.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
COLOMBIA . Chocó : Acandí , Capurganá ; Jardín Botánico del Darién , Vereda Los Ríos , Wet forest , Pitfall trap ,
90m
[ 8°38′23.12″N , 77°21′1.53″W ], E. González , D. Montañez & D. Peña leg.,
24.IV.2007
, 1 ♀ ( MPUJ _ ENT 0068208 )
,
Capurganá ; Jardín Botánico del Darién , Vereda Los Girasoles , Wet forest , Pitfall trap ,
250m
, N. López leg.,
24.IV.2007
, 1 ♂ ( MPUJ _ ENT 0062009 )
,
Capurganá ; Jardín Botánico del Darién , Vereda Los Ríos , Wet forest , Pitfall trap ,
90m
, S. Calvo , M. Marta & J. Suarez leg.,
31. III .2009
, 1 ♂ ( MPUJ _ ENT 0062001 )
,
60m
, A. Bernal leg., same date, 1 ♂ ( MPUJ _ ENT 0061975 )
,
90m
, same collector,
28. III .2009
, 2 ♂ ( MPUJ _ ENT 0061988 )
,
Wet forest , stubble,
60m
, M. Camargo & J. Izquierdo leg.,
11.IV.2008
, 1 ♂ ( MPUJ _ ENT 0061962 )
.

Diagnosis. Males of
Tenedos barronus ( Chamberlin, 1925 )
, resemble those of
T. hoeferi Jocqué & Baert, 2002
, by having exceptionally developed conductor (C) curved at prolateral side; short, conical retrolateral tibial apophysis (RTA) (see Jocqué & Baert, 2002: 87 , 100, figs 10A–B; 18B–C; figs 12A–D; 13A–B; 14A–F), but can be recognized by bifid median apophysis, anterior branch (aMA) thin, procurved, apically filiform, posterior branch (pMA) very short ( Figs 12A–D ; 13A–B ; 14A–F ). Females are similar to those of
T. hoeferi Jocqué & Baert, 2002
and
T. quadrangulatus Jocqué & Baert, 2002
, by long seminal receptacles (SR) curved towards median septum; sub-quadrangular-shaped atrium (A), posteriorly delimited (see Jocqué & Baert, 2002: 87 , 100, 116, figs 10C–D, 18D–E, 33A–B; figs 12E–F; 13C–D), but can be distinguished by the shape of the median field plate (MFP), wider than long, slightly bilobed at posterior edge; elliptic-shaped atrium ( Figs 12E–F ; 13C–D ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11.
Tenedos barronus ( Chamberlin, 1925 )
. A–B. Male habitus (MPUJ_ENT 0062001): A. Dorsal view. B. Ventral view. C–D. Female habitus (MPUJ_ENT 0061949): C. Dorsal view. D. Ventral view. Scale bar: A–D: 2mm.

FIGURE 12.
Tenedos barronus ( Chamberlin, 1925 )
. A–D. Male palp (MPUJ_ENT 0062001): A. Prolateral view. B. Retroventral view. C. Ventral view (asterisk indicates the BTM and the arrow indicates the apical macrosetae on the cymbium). D. Retrolateral view. E–F. Female epigyne (MPUJ_ENT 0061949): E. Ventral view (square showing the median field delimitation). F. Dorsal view. Scale bars: A–B: 200µm; C–D: 500µm; E–F: 100µm. Abbreviations: A, atrium; ApC, appendix of the conductor; C, conductor; CO, copulatory ducts; E, embolus; EB, embolus base; FD, fertilization ducts; MA, median apophysis; MFP, median field plate; RTA, retrolateral tibial apophysis; S, spermathecae; SD, spermatic ducts; SR, seminal receptacles; St, subtegulum; VTA, ventral tibial apophysis.

FIGURE 13.
Tenedos barronus ( Chamberlin, 1925 )
. A–B. Male palp (MPUJ_ENT 0062001): A. Ventral view. B. Retrolateral view. C–D. Female epigyne (MPUJ_ENT 0061949): C. Ventral view. D. Dorsal view. Scale bars: A–B: 200µm; C–D: 500µm. Abbreviations: A, atrium; ApC, appendix of the conductor; C, conductor; CD, copulatory ducts; E, embolus; FD, fertilization ducts; MA, median apophysis; MFP, median field plate; RPC, retrolateral process of the cymbium; RTA, retrolateral tibial apophysis; S, spermathecae; SD, spermatic ducts; SR, seminal receptacles; VTA, ventral tibial apophysis.

FIGURE 14.
Tenedos barronus ( Chamberlin, 1925 )
. A–F. Male palp (MPUJ_ENT 0062009), SEM images: A. Ventral view (arrow indicates the apical macrosetae on the cymbium). B. Retrolateral view. C. Median apophysis (arrow indicates the reduced posterior branch of the median apophysis). D. Basal surface of the tegulum showing the BTM. E. Retrolateral trichobothriae on the cymbium. F. Detailed trichobothria on the cymbium. Abbreviations: A, atrium; ApC, appendix of the conductor; C, conductor; BTM, basal tegular membrane; E, embolus; MA, median apophysis; RPC, retrolateral process of the cymbium; RTA, retrolateral tibial apophysis; St, subtegulum; T, tegulum; VTA, ventral tibial apophysis.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Males (n=4): total length: 5.93–6.69; carapace length: 2.89–3.01; femur I length: 1.62–1.64.
Distribution. Known from the type locality (Barro Colorado Island, Panama ) and Chocó department , Colombia ( Fig. 106 ).
